title: Augusta County: Tony Pastor to Annie Harris, June 10, 1861
summary: Pastor describes one of his first guard duties and the general hardships he has faced in his early time in the army. He also asks Annie to find more recruits for his company, offering specific suggestions and mentioning that his company is falling behind the others in numbers. Parkers also hopes that all is well on the homefront, and he sends his regards home.
keywords: Camp Life, Women, Homefront, Enlistment, American Civil War
